key_points: Representative Anthony Gonzalez announced he will not seek reelection in 2022.
Gonzalez is the first GOP congressman who voted to impeach Trump to not run for another term.
He cited family considerations and the current state of politics as reasons for his decision.
Gonzalez, along with nine other House Republicans, voted to impeach Trump after the January 6 Capitol attack.
The impeachment was based on Trump's role in inciting the mob and his lack of response during the attack.
Gonzalez and other pro-impeachment Republicans faced backlash within their party.
Various GOP leaders and donors expressed their disappointment and withdrew support.
Max Miller, a former Trump aide and his endorsed candidate, is running for Gonzalez's seat.
Miller stated Gonzalez's decision to not run was 'great news for the voters' and criticized him for betraying constituents.
Gonzalez has served Ohio's 16th Congressional District since 2019.
spokespersons: Doug Deeken (Republican Party Chair in Wayne County)
Max Miller (Former Trump aide and Republican candidate)
